text:
Singapore-Rajasthan ink deal to set up tourism skills centre
A skills centre will be set up in Udaipur, Rajasthan to train 480 students in the tourism and hospitality sector annually, as per a memorandum of understanding signed between Singapore and Rajasthan state government.
The MoU was signed between Singapore’s High Commissioner to India Lim Thuan Kuan and the Rajasthan government’s director of technical education training, Mr Anil Kumar Anand, in the state capital, Jaipur, yesterday ( Aug 6).
The centre will further boost Singapore’s involvement in skills training in India.
Housed in the government-run Industrial Training Institute (ITI) in Udaipur, the centre is expected to start in September next year with 36 teachers and will offer six courses ranging from culinary training to hospitality.
The agreement provides for Rajasthan government to construct the facilities at the ITI, while ITE Education Services (ITEES), the private arm of Singapore’s Institute of Technical Education, will provide consultancy services for developing infrastructure, courses and training the trainers.
According to sources, ITEES had conducted a “needs assessment” and found that there is demand for skilled manpower in the tourism and hospitality industry in Rajasthan.
